summary: This document is a subcommittee report for July-August 1963 on actions taken to combat Castro-Communist subversion. It details efforts by the CIA and Department of State to control travel to and from Cuba, movement of propaganda, clandestine movement of guerrillas and arms, and transfer of funds. It also covers strengthening counter-insurgency capabilities, exchange of intelligence on subversion, surveillance of Cuban missions, and other special actions.
title: Report for July - August on Actions Taken to Combat Castro-Communist Subversion
recipient: Members of Subcommittee on Castro-Communist Subversion
